result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador Montes Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $875.00 payable to Milwaukee Police Department as to Count 1 and $600.00 payable to Milwaukee Police Department as to Count 2 by the end of sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
- Pay any monetary amounts ordered by not paid while in the institution.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
**01-13-17/Postconviction Motion Hearing, Court VACATES the fines in the amounts of $1475.00 as to Counts 1 & 2 as previously ordered on 05-11-16.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count one.  (Return Address:  Salvador Montes, Jr. #643331, Fox Lake Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 200, Fox Lake, WI  53933).

Defendant Salvador Montes in court with attorney Christopher August and attorney Andrea Taylor Cornwall.  
Defendant Salvador Montes in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

Motion Hearing proceeds.  Oral argument given by counsel.  The state takes no position.
The Court GRANTS defense motion for reasons set forth.  
The Court VACATES the fines in the amount of $1475.00 (as to Count 1 and 2) ordered on 5-11-16 and orders the judgment of conviction amended to reflect such.

records.addlTxt:
Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years - consecutive to Count 1; pay a fine of $600 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.; pay restitution in the amount of $600 to the Milwuakee Police Department by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) seek and maintain employment. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis - no DNA surcharge.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Salvador Montes in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Salvador Montes in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections made to the PSI report.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years with 62 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years; pay a fine of $875 plus mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to collection; pay restitution in the amount of $875 to the Milwaukee Police Department by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to collection.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Salvador Montes not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Klimetz states the defendant is "thinking" of hiring Attorney John Forrestal.  Neither party has heard if he has been retained.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Salvador Montes not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Klimetz was just appointed on this case and has no information.  Defendant missed his sentencing date.  Court orders the defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Court sets case for status so Attorney Klimetz can obtain all the sentencing materials.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No warrant in file.  Deputy is trying to track down the warrant at this time.  Case set for return on warrant on 3-24-16 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.  Public defender's office and ADA Crivello notified of next date./ds
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court earlier.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Laura A Crivello who appeared earlier.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Salvador Montes in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Salvador Montes in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  PSI ORDERED, SIGNED AND FILED.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Salvador Montes in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales, and attorney Marc Christopher.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has some problems with immigration, and needs to talk with an immigration attorney.  Defendant wants to resolve the case.  Defense counsel would like attorney Christopher to substitute in as counsel, since he deals with immigration issues.  Court does not allow attorney Christopher to come in on the case.  Case is still scheduled for jury trial on August 18, 2014.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 8/11/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Motion to dismiss case by defense counsel; arguments to the Court.  Court denies motion.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (NO ILLEGAL DRUGS).   DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON MARCH 6, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Salvador Montes in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
